it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.model.player

Class PlayerBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.common.observer.Observable<ModelUpdate>
      • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.model.player.PlayerBoard

  • public class PlayerBoard
extends Observable<ModelUpdate>
    Holds damage, marks and deaths of a certain player. It is also provides a method to calculate each player's scores when the board needs to be scored (e.g. killshot), based on the state (regular or frenzy).
    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini, Lorenzo Farinelli, Tiziano Fucci

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int KILLSHOT_DAMAGE
      Number of damage tokens to perform a killshot Fall back to a default value of 11 tokens if none is set
      static int MAX_DAMAGES
      Number of maximum damage tokens
      static int MAX_MARKS_PER_PLAYER
      Maximum marks each other player can have on this board Fall back to a default value of 3 marks if none is set
      static int OVERKILL_DAMAGE
      Number of damage tokens to perform an overkill

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected PlayerBoard(Player player)
      Constructs a player board with no damages, marks or deaths and in regular state, suitable for the start of the match.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDamage(Player shooter, int count)
      Adds damage by given player.
      void addDeath()
      Increment deaths by one.
      void addMark(Player shooter, int count)
      Adds marks by given player.
      PlayerBoardView generateView()
      Generates the PlayerBoardView of the player board
      int getDamageCount()
      Returns the number of damage tokens on this board.
      List<Player> getDamages()
      Returns a duplicate of the internal list of damages.
      int getDeaths()
      Returns the number of times this player died, either by killshot or overkill.
      Player getKillshot()
      Returns the player who performed the killshot, if any.
      int getMarksByPlayer(Player player)
      Returns the number of marks on the board delivered by a certain player.
      Player getOverkill()
      Returns the player who performed the overkill, if any.
      Player getPlayer()
      Returns the owner of this board.
      Map<Player,Integer> getPlayerScores()
      Calculates and returns in a map the scores for all the players who did at least one damage to the owner of the player board, automatically resolving draws.
      PlayerBoardState getState()
      Returns the state of the player board (regular, frenzy)
      boolean isDead()
      Returns whether the player is dead or not.
      void turnFrenzy()
      Turn the playerboard to the frenzy state and deaths are removed as they don't count for scoring.
      void updateDeathsAndReset()
      Checks whether the player is dead or not, then increments the number of deaths accordingly and resets all damage on the board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerBoard

        protected PlayerBoard(Player player)
        Constructs a player board with no damages, marks or deaths and in regular state, suitable for the start of the match.
        Parameters:
        player - owner of the player board, not null

    • Method Detail

      • getDeaths

        public int getDeaths()
        Returns the number of times this player died, either by killshot or overkill.
        Returns:
        number of deaths

      • addDeath

        public void addDeath()
        Increment deaths by one.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Returns the owner of this board.
        Returns:
        owner of this board

      • getDamages

        public List<Player> getDamages()
        Returns a duplicate of the internal list of damages.
        Returns:
        a list of players representing the suffered damages, in chronological order

      • getDamageCount

        public int getDamageCount()
        Returns the number of damage tokens on this board.
        Returns:
        number of damage tokens on this board

      • addDamage

        public void addDamage(Player shooter,
                      int count)
        Adds damage by given player. If damage exceeds capacity, it is simply discarded. If there are marks by the shooter, these are removed and turn to damage.
        Parameters:
        shooter - player who did the damage, not the owner of the player board, not null
        count - number of damage tokens, must be positive

      • addMark

        public void addMark(Player shooter,
                    int count)
        Adds marks by given player. If tokens exceed maximum number per player, they are simply discarded.
        Parameters:
        shooter - player who sent the marks, not the owner of the player board, not null
        count - number of marks to add, must be positive

      • getMarksByPlayer

        public int getMarksByPlayer(Player player)
        Returns the number of marks on the board delivered by a certain player. If there are no marks by that player, it will simply return 0.
        Parameters:
        player - player who sent the marks, not null
        Returns:
        number of marks, in range 0..MAX_MARKS_PER_PLAYER

      • getKillshot

        public Player getKillshot()
        Returns the player who performed the killshot, if any.
        Returns:
        player who performed the killshot, null otherwise

      • getOverkill

        public Player getOverkill()
        Returns the player who performed the overkill, if any. Note: overkill implies killshot.
        Returns:
        player who performed the overkill, null otherwise

      • getPlayerScores

        public Map<Player,Integer> getPlayerScores()
        Calculates and returns in a map the scores for all the players who did at least one damage to the owner of the player board, automatically resolving draws. Does not reset the board after calculation. Players who delivered no damage won't be in the map.
        Returns:
        map<player, score> with each player who got points

      • updateDeathsAndReset

        public void updateDeathsAndReset()
                          throws PlayerException
        Checks whether the player is dead or not, then increments the number of deaths accordingly and resets all damage on the board.
        Throws:
        PlayerException - if the player is not dead

      • turnFrenzy

        public void turnFrenzy()
                throws PlayerException
        Turn the playerboard to the frenzy state and deaths are removed as they don't count for scoring. This can only be done if there are no damages. Marks are left untouched.
        Throws:
        PlayerException - if there are damages on the board

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Returns whether the player is dead or not.
        Returns:
        true if the player is dead, false otherwise

      • getState

        public PlayerBoardState getState()
        Returns the state of the player board (regular, frenzy)
        Returns:
        the state of the player board

      • generateView

        public PlayerBoardView generateView()
        Generates the PlayerBoardView of the player board
        Returns:
        the player board view
